page.title: 13HEREFORD DEPUTY TOWN CLERK
page.content: IN PARLIMENT FOR FOR THE LORDS HEARING OF HEREFORD BILL.{ LORDS ABERDARE, MURTON WELLS PESTELL PRESIDE. MICHEAL PRITCHARD SKILFULLY PRESENTS THE COUNCIL CASE FOR THE RETENTION OF POWERS TO GIVE GRATUITIES TO NON-SUPERANNUABLE EMPLOYEES, CLOSURE OF CASTLE GREEN AND BISHOPS MEADOW OCCASIONALLY AND HOLDING THE MAY FAIR IN THE STREETS . COMMITTEE AMUSED BY PHOTOGRAPH OF LORD BISHOP ON HELTER-SKELTER.COMMITTEE AGREE TO NEW POWERS ON CHIMNEYS STOPPED-UP DRAINS, EATING HOUSES, DUSTBINS,STRAY DOGS,GRASS VERGES ,LEISURE CENTRES,ELECTRICAL IN- STALLATIONS, SENOND-HAND GOODS DEALERS ,TOUTING,BUILDING REGULATIONS,THE RIVER WYE, MASSAGE PARLOURS,OVERNIGHT PARKING OF GOODS VEHICLES,PARKING ON FOOTWAYS AND ARMORIAL BEARING.ON OATH I PROVE THE PREAMABLE TO THE BILL
